meaningMnemonic: The taste of something with <kanji>acid</kanji> is... well... you'd think it'd be acidic, but it's a <vocabulary>sour</vocabulary> taste. Some acidic things are pretty sour, though. Lemons are pretty acidic, and they're super sour too, so think about that when you need to remember this word.
readingMnemonic: Something was so <vocabulary>sour</vocabulary> that it broke your mouth. You were so upset about this, that you decided to <reading>sue</reading> (す) the maker of this nasty sour thing.
